11− 13 Bi 2O 3 has several polymorphs, such as α-phase (monoclinic structure), β-phase (tetragonal structure), γ-phase (body-centered cubic structure), and δ-phase (cubic fluorite structure).
14 The band structure of Bi 2O 3 is constituted by a valence band composed of a hybrid Bi 6s and O 2p orbital and a conduction band of Bi 6p.
15− 19 A pale yellowish α phase stably exists at room temperature and is stable up to 730 °C. At 730 °C and above, the α phase is transferred to the orange δ phase. δ-Bi 2O 3 has been suggested as a good electrolyte material for solid oxide fuel cells and gas sensors, because this compound is stable at high temperatures and exhibits high oxide ion conductivity.
